title: Missing input file(s) after renames when file watch service is enabled

labels.name: team-Core
labels.description: Skyframe, bazel query, BEP, options parsing, bazelrc

body:
### Description of the bug:


With `--watchfs` enabled, a directory rename of Java sources followed by renaming it back can leave Bazel in a stale state where it continues to report a missing input that actually exists.

### Which category does this issue belong to?

Core

### What's the simplest, easiest way to reproduce this bug? Please provide a minimal example if possible.


1. download [hello-bazel-java.zip](https://github.com/user-attachments/files/22077127/hello-bazel-java.zip)
2. run demo.sh
```
$ cat demo.sh
set -euxo pipefail

bazelisk shutdown

bazelisk build //... --watchfs
mv src/main/java/com/example/{app,app2}
bazelisk build //... --watchfs || true
mv src/main/java/com/example/{app2,app}
bazelisk build //... --watchfs
mv src/main/java/com/example/{app,app2}
bazelisk build //... --watchfs || true
mv src/main/java/com/example/{app2,app}
bazelisk build //... --watchfs && echo OK || {
    echo FAIL, try again after shutdown
    bazelisk shutdown
    bazelisk build //... --watchfs
    exit 1
}
```

### Which operating system are you running Bazel on?


Ubuntu 22.04.5 LTS

### What is the output of `bazel info release`?


release 8.3.1

### If `bazel info release` returns `development version` or `(@non-git)`, tell us how you built Bazel.
